task.title: How To Replace a Synology WRX560 Wi-Fi Router
task.shortdesc: Whether you're replacing it due to performance issues or you just want a change, this guide will walk you through the process of uninstalling your old Synology WRX560 Wi-Fi router and replacing it with your new one!

taskbody.prereq:
What You'll Need
A new Synology WRX560 Wi-Fi Router
An ISP Modem
An AC Power Adapter
An RJ-45 LAN Cable
A working outlet
A device for set-up (phone, laptop, desktop, etc.)
taskbody.context: If you order a new Synology router, the package should come with a new power adapter and LAN cable as well. If it doesn't, contact your reseller!

step.cmd: Disconnect all of your devices from the old router's Wi-Fi network.

stepresult.note: For wired devices, this means powering them off, and for wireless devices, this means signing them out of the old network in Settings.

step.cmd: Turn off your old router and modem.

substep.cmd: Take photos of the cable setup for your old router and modem. This can be used as a reference when you install the new router, just in case you forget which ports the cables are plugged into.

fig.title: Up-Close Shot of the Ports of a Synology WRX560 Router

step.cmd: Unplug any cables from the old router, including the power adapter and the LAN cable.
Dispose of the old router and any other hardware you're swapping out for the new installation.

stepresult.note: It's recommended that you at least replace your power adapter cable, even if you don't replace your LAN cable; keeping the old power adapter could lead to performance issues in your new router.

step.cmd: Install the hardware for your new router as normal.
Set up the software for your new router as normal.

taskbody.result: Congratulations, you've successfully replaced your old Synology WRX560 router with a new one! If you need a quick refresher on the installation process, feel free to check out our user guide on the procedure. You can also visit Synology's official website if you have any questions!
